verses.verse: And Zedekiah<WH6667> the son<WH1121> of Josiah<WH2977> reigned<WH4427> as king<WH4428>, instead of Coniah<WH3659> the son<WH1121> of Jehoiakim<WH3079>, whom Nebuchadrezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> made king<WH4427> in the land<WH776> of Judah<WH3063>.

But neither he<WH5650>, nor his servants, nor the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776>, did hearken<WH8085> unto the words<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068>, which he spake<WH1696> by<WH3027> the prophet<WH5030> Jeremiah<WH3414>.

And Zedekiah<WH6667> the king<WH4428> sent<WH7971> Jehucal<WH3081> the son<WH1121> of Shelemiah<WH8018>, and Zephaniah<WH6846> the son<WH1121> of Maaseiah<WH4641>, the priest<WH3548>, to the prophet<WH5030> Jeremiah<WH3414>, saying<WH559>, Pray<WH6419> now unto Jehovah<WH3068> our God for us<WH430>.
Now Jeremiah<WH3414> came in<WH935> and went out<WH3318> among<WH8432> the people<WH5971>; for they had not put<WH5414> him into prison<WH1004>.

And Pharaoh<WH6547>'s army<WH2428> was come forth<WH3318> out<WH3318> of Egypt<WH4714>; and when the Chaldeans<WH3778> that were besieging<WH6696> Jerusalem<WH3389> heard<WH8085> tidings<WH8088> of them<WH3389>, they brake up from Jerusalem.
Then came the word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068> unto the prophet<WH5030> Jeremiah<WH3414>, saying<WH559>,

Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, Thus shall ye say<WH559> to the king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063>, that sent<WH7971> you unto me to inquire<WH1875> of me<WH6547>: Behold, Pharaoh's army<WH2428>, which is come forth<WH3318> to help<WH5833> you<WH7725>, shall return to Egypt<WH4714> into their own land<WH776>.
And the Chaldeans<WH3778> shall come again<WH7725>, and fight<WH3898> against this city<WH5892>; and they shall take<WH3920> it<WH8313>, and burn it with fire<WH784>.
Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, Deceive<WH5377> not yourselves<WH5315>, saying<WH559>, The Chaldeans<WH3778> shall surely<WH1980> depart<WH3212> from us<WH3212>; for they shall not depart.

For though ye had smitten<WH5221> the whole army<WH2428> of the Chaldeans<WH3778> that fight<WH3898> against you<WH7604>, and there remained but wounded<WH1856> men<WH582> among them<WH6965>, yet would they rise up every man<WH376> in his tent<WH168>, and burn<WH8313> this city<WH5892> with fire<WH784>.
And it came to pass that<WH2428>, when the army of the Chaldeans<WH3778> was broken up<WH5927> from Jerusalem<WH3389> for fear<WH6440> of Pharaoh<WH6547>'s army<WH2428>,

then Jeremiah<WH3414> went forth<WH3318> out<WH3318> of Jerusalem<WH3389> to go<WH3212> into the land<WH776> of Benjamin<WH1144>, to receive his portion there<WH8432>, in the midst of the people<WH5971>.

And when he was in the gate<WH8179> of Benjamin<WH1144>, a captain<WH1167> of the ward<WH6488> was there<WH8034>, whose name was Irijah<WH3376>, the son<WH1121> of Shelemiah<WH8018>, the son<WH1121> of Hananiah<WH2608>; and he laid hold<WH8610> on Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030>, saying<WH559>, Thou art falling away<WH5307> to the Chaldeans<WH3778>.

Then said<WH559> Jeremiah<WH3414>, It is false<WH8267>; I am not falling away<WH5307> to the Chaldeans<WH3778>. But he hearkened<WH8085> not to him<WH3376>; so Irijah laid hold<WH8610> on Jeremiah<WH3414>, and brought<WH8610> him to the princes<WH8269>.

And the princes<WH8269> were wroth<WH7107> with Jeremiah<WH3414>, and smote<WH5221> him<WH5414>, and put him in prison<WH612> in the house<WH1004> of Jonathan<WH3083> the scribe<WH5608>; for they had made<WH6213> that the prison<WH3608>.
When Jeremiah<WH3414> was come into<WH935> the dungeon-house<WH1004>, and into the cells<WH2588>, and Jeremiah<WH3414> had remained<WH3427> there many<WH7227> days<WH3117>;

Then Zedekiah<WH6667> the king<WH4428> sent<WH7971>, and fetched<WH3947> him<WH4428>: and the king asked<WH7592> him secretly<WH5643> in his house<WH1004>, and said<WH559>, Is there any word<WH1697> from Jehovah<WH3068>? And Jeremiah<WH3414> said<WH559>, There is<WH3426>. He said<WH559> also<WH5414>, Thou shalt be delivered into the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>.

Moreover Jeremiah<WH3414> said<WH559> unto king<WH4428> Zedekiah<WH6667>, Wherein have I sinned<WH2398> against thee<WH5650>, or against thy servants, or against this people<WH5971>, that ye have put<WH5414> me in prison<WH1004>?
Where now<WH346> are your prophets<WH5030> that prophesied<WH5012> unto you<WH559>, saying, The king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> shall not come<WH935> against you<WH776>, nor against this land?

And now hear<WH8085>, I pray thee<WH113>, O my lord the king<WH4428>: let my supplication<WH8467>, I pray thee<WH5307>, be presented before<WH6440> thee<WH7725>, that thou cause me not to return to the house<WH1004> of Jonathan<WH3083> the scribe<WH5608>, lest I die there<WH4191>.

Then Zedekiah<WH6667> the king<WH4428> commanded<WH6680>, and they committed<WH6485> Jeremiah<WH3414> into the court<WH2691> of the guard<WH4307>; and they gave<WH5414> him daily<WH3117> a loaf<WH3603> of bread<WH3899> out of the bakers<WH644>' street<WH2351>, until all the bread<WH3899> in the city<WH5892> was spent<WH8552>. Thus Jeremiah<WH3414> remained<WH3427> in the court<WH2691> of the guard<WH4307>.
